channel.title: Half Life: Source from HL2: GotY Edition
channel.description:
Hello, Forumites! I debated placing this one in "Half-Life Series" but since this is a question about help or support, I placed it here.
I came across an old copy of Half Life 2... It's the "Game of the Year" edition. It says that it has Counterstrike Source, HL2: Deathmatch, and HL: Source as well as HL2.
My question: I can't find how to install Half-Life: Source from the three discs that were in the case. The only option I can find on all three discs is "Install Half-Life 2". I already have the Steam version of HL2 and I'm dubious about installing that over the Steam version (I guess I could install it somewhere else) simply to get to HL: Source.
I don't want this to turn into a discussion about the pros and cons of HL: Source or your feelings on it. I just want to know how to install it using the GotY edition. Do I really have to install HL2: GotY to get at HL: Source?
Thanks!

item.title: Half Life: Source from HL2: GotY Edition
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
That’s kind of what I was afraid of. I’ve asked Valve for a new key before on another game but they said that it would cost $10. If that’s the case, then I might as well just buy it off Steam and be done with it.

Ah well. It was a nice thought…
